text: I had some issues in my package today where some functionality in DiffEqBase.jl couldn't be found (e.g. `DiffEqBase.interpret_vars`). I then found out about SciMLBase.jl, added it as a dependency which solved most errors, but since I still rely on DiffEqBase.jl and on OrdinaryDiffEq.jl I now have lots of warnings about common exports, and I have to fix a few more issues. It's a bit unclear to me which functions I should use, and how I should handle these dependencies in general. Does anyone have any recommendations for issues of this kind?

text: DiffEqBase.jl started getting a ton of shared functionality between the differential equation solvers, like callback handling and such, which are not necessary to define the interface and created circular dependencies with non differential equation stuff like NonlinearSolve.jl

text: so SciMLBase.jl holds "the interface", while DiffEqBase.jl holds a lot of the diffeq-specific extensions, but most packages can probably get away with only depending on SciMLBase.jl
